Reviews.Title: SP-565UZ is a dream camera for me! Great for Genealogy!
Reviews.Author: Jeri J. Steele "Jeri J Steele, Pioneer Inform...
Reviews.Content: I owned an 550UZ for 18 months and decided to upgrade to the 565UZ for the extra mega-pixels and other feature differences. I'm an amateur photographer but married to a professional. We originally purchased the 550UZ so that I had a camera that was easy for me to use yet if I wanted to I could override the settings while I learned more about photography from him. First, I have used both cameras extensively for copying pages from books, copying photographs, and snapping microfilm screens in libraries for my genealogical research. With the document mode the camera is in almost the perfect settings. I always use a custom white balance so that I don't have to do ANYTHING to the book photos. I have taught several other genealogists who are not techies to use this camera and set the white balance! The same camera goes immediately outside for tourist pictures with stunning results. Like all AF cameras you have to be aware of where the camera is focusing and make sure you press the shutter button down half way and give the camera time to focus. Many times I get as good shots as my husband's (his still has more pixels!). The extra 2X zoom helps get nicer long shots in focus. My favorite part of working with this camera is being able to swap between outside landscape mode to available light shots to documents within seconds!

Reviews.Title: SP570UZ done right!
Reviews.Author: lordhoot "lordhoot"
Reviews.Content: After playing around with this camera for a week, I can cheerfully say that this is what Olympus SP570UZ should have been in the first place. The Olympus SP565UZ (I am cutting out the SP and UZ from this point on) is not only smaller and lighter then 570 but it also got auto focus and AUTO-ZOOM feature. How surprising that turned out to be.In essence, 565 is an physical makeover of the 570. It is in fact, 570 in all its capabilities but better. Its better because it was able to maintained most of the features of the 570 while improving on its deficits. Outside of putting back in the auto zoom that was my biggest and major complaint about the 570, they also managed to fixed my second complaint, the viewfinder that is far more easier to use then 570. Only the video remain the same but I can live with that shortcoming.On the downside, this camera still uses Olympus xD card, one of the most inferior media cards in the market. I don't know why Olympus just bite the bullet and take one for their camera industry and do away with the xD card. Thus, unless you are in one of those burst modes, the recycle speed of this camera will NOT be breaking any records. Another minor downside for me at least is that their self timer mode is still at 2 seconds and 12 seconds. I was kind of hoping that they might have an custom self-timer like Canon ultra-zoom cameras got.This camera do take a micro-SD card. Inside the box, there is an adapter for the micro SD card. Its in the shape of a xD card of course. I supposed this was added on so you can download easier to your phone or IPod or whatever. Of course, they could be like Fuji and add a second slot for SD card. But who is whining anyway??As Amazon stated, this camera have more of a point and shoot feel then the 570. Anyone who have handled the old 550 and 560 can easily handled this 565 without much adjustments. The menu has been changed to streamlined thing. Back of the camera has definitely changed. But its still one of the best cameras to use in comfort. On the 570, there were four buttons on the left side of the LCD screen, now all these buttons are located around the cursor button like the old 550 and 560. One button on the 570 that is missing on the 565 is the auto exposure lock button. That function is now served by a custom button, a slight downgrade for some. This camera however, managed to keep all the manual features of the 570. In fact, if you put this camera into the "manual mode", it is almost like having a small version of 570 in your hands. The rubberized grip on the lens appears to be a carry over from the 570.Overall, if you enjoyed the 550 and 560, then you will have no problem enjoying 565 series. The 20x zoom is fantastic, all the frills like shadow adjustments and face detections worked just fine. They also add another feature I haven't use much but sound promising. They called it "pre capture" and you have to use a lower resolution but when you half press the shutter, it take ten photos at once and you get pick which one you like the best after you finished it off by pushing the shutter button all the way down. Weird but if you got the card space and the time to review all ten shots, then its pretty neat.Hope this review been helpful in some ways.

Reviews.Title: Maxed Zoom Not the Best Image Quality
Reviews.Author: Birdie
Reviews.Content: I have 3 digital ultra-zooms, the Olympus SP-565UZ, the Panasonic FZ18, and an older Kodak ultra-zoom when 10x optical zoom was the standard. I predominantly take outdoor photos of songbirds in trees, water fowl, farm animals and landscapes so if you are mostly a people photographer or an indoor photographer, check out the other reviews and skip this one.The Olympus 565UZ has a lot of noise when the optical zoom is maxed out at 20x and that's a disappointment because I mostly use the camera at 20x.  Also, all of the images, at any distance, are soft.  Although you can use the camera menu to increase the sharpness of the image, every image still needs additional sharpening on the computer.I rarely use the 565UZ on the auto setting because the outdoor images are too bright preferring one of the other modes where I can adjust exposure.  It is, however, an easy camera to use and I had the shortest learning curve with the 565UZ.  The color quality of the images is good and you can opt for a vivid setting over a natural one, if that's what you desire.  The 565UZ has a great variety of camera pre-sets in scene mode and there is a macro and super macro setting, as well.The Panasonic FZ18 takes the best quality images of the three cameras, when the optical zoom is maxed out, but with Olympus going to a 26x optical zoom and Kodak going to a 24x optical zoom, it's hard for a person who likes to take bird photos to stick with Panasonic's FZ18, 18x optical zoom camera.  I also think the Panasonic FZ18 LCD screen is better than the Olympus 565UZ LCD screen but since I only use an LCD screen to review photos, I can't say which camera's LCD screen is better for taking photos.If you are used to a sharp, no noise image, don't need the 20x max optical zoom and you don't need such a big variety of scene pre-sets, I think there are better ultra-zoom camera choices than the Olympus 565UZ. I hope they have improved the image quality (noise and softness) on their new 590UZ because 26x optical zoom is so tempting.

Reviews.Title: Auto mode and user interface needs work
Reviews.Author: Sy
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera recently but here is my initial take.  Ideally I'd like to have a camera that can take intelligent pictures without much guess when in auto mode.  Some of my pictures in auto mode will come out nice and others will come out blurry, even in good light conditions.  Any settings saved in auto mode or scn mode are reset just by changing modes or turning off the camera.  So if you don't want to use iESP and want to use spot focus instead, you have to keep resetting it each time.  Settings will only be saved in P, A, S, M or video modes.  Macros come out really nice.  Zoom is great, but can loose focus in auto mode especially if zoomed to the max.  The evf switches to lcd screen after each shot, so you have to watch it on the screen after each shot and not on the evf.  When switching between scene modes, you have to go through lots of buttons and you cant see how the image looks through the lens, instead you see the built in images representing each mode and then it switches to a text description for each mode.  I miss having the scenes on the dial and to be able to see the images as they appear while going through each scene.  The feel and the construction of the camera is excellent.  If Olympus can just work on their user interface and the auto intelligent mode, this camera can rock.  Sometimes when you have to take a quick shot, you want to rely on the auto mode.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-565UZ Rave Review
Reviews.Author: DeeJay
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for about 4 weeks and find it awesome. Taking photos for real estate presentations has been simplified by the excellent wide angle views that are possible, and the panorama shots are very useful and easy to produce. The 20x telephoto lens take excellent photos of the moon at 10mpx with the moon filling the entire frame.The only thing I don't care for is that the camera uses AAA batteries. This is eased by using LiMH rechargables but less convenient than having a built-in charger. I have used most but not all of the many fine features and find the menu navigation the easiest and most intuitive I have seen in any camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for sports shots
Reviews.Author: T. Sergi "baseball mom"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to take pictures of my sons playing baseball and for our little league year book.  It is easy to use and has features that help me to get the shots that I need.  The sports setting takes shots without a delay, and by holding down the button, I can get multiple shots so that I don't have to try to time out the play at home plate in order to get the shot.  I have been very pleased with the results.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with my purchase - would recommend
Reviews.Author: Jack Connell "pantheon"
Reviews.Content: I checked and read consumer group, professional, and average "Joe six pack" reviews until I realized that it was like choosing wine, if you like it, it's good.  Well I like this camera.  I bought it to get back some of the self determination and "artistic" choices that it affords unlike many "point & shoot" where you get what the camera gives you.  The "UZ" has a powerful zoom capability combined with high resolution, without having to once again start packing around a suitcase full of optional lenses and such.  It has plenty of features and options so that I can "participate" in the image formulation process as much or as little as I choose. In fact this camera has features that I will likely never use.  In the little time that I have used the 565 camera I find that it takes great pictures, limited only by the person pushing the button.  It is a size and form that fits naturally in my grip. I am looking forward to learning even more about the camera as I use the settings options in other situations. It provides you a multitude of options in a very small, easily portable package with enough information, for each option on the screen, that you don't need to memorize the manual.  Nice controls layout that even works for big fingers. Thank you Olympus.

Reviews.Title: So far so great
Reviews.Author: B. Davis
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera and first of all I'll say that the olympus 565uz requires you to put some effort into learning its features, but right off the bat in scene mode you can take awesome pictures.  The 33 stored scene modes really give you a wide array of settings so that you can just point and click in most situations.The ability to manually change every last little detail is awesome though because there are going to be situations where the picture is just not right, but rest assured you can make it right with this camera.  Just takes some learning and playing with manual settings.The pictures are very crisp, detailed, and the colors are amazing.  Also I've had a lot of success with night shots.  I'm amazed at how it pulls the light out of anything it can and takes a real good shot.The zoom is very nice as well.  At full zoom I'd say you can get a real nice shot at about 200 yards.  100 - 150 yards the thing you are taking a picture of looks like its pretty close with a good amount of detail.  I have not tried shots beyond 200 yards yet, but as I said you still get a pretty nice picture with an OK amount of detail at that distance.  Plus beyond the 20x zoom you can do a 5x digital zoom within that picture.  The only thing I will say about 100% zoomed is that it requires the lighting and situations to be pretty good otherwise you'll get blurred images.  Like if you are trying to take a picture of a deer that is 200 yards from you but there is another one that is only 100 yards from you right in the line of sight the focus of the 100 yards will blur the 200 a bit.But for the price it's pretty dang good at a distance.Other than that I'll say I love the panorama feature.  It takes a picture then lines it up on either side so you can pan the camera line it up and take the next picture.  Comes out awesome.Also the built in flash is very good.  Exactly what you'd expect.There are cons thoughThe first is that it takes xD card max 2GB so you'll have to buy a couple of them because 10mp pictures are not small.The second is the LCD is sort of small, but the overall camera is very compact which is great for carrying and traveling, but with that feature you lose LCD screen space.The third is that it doesn't use mini-usb chord to connect to the computer.  It resembles a mini-usb very much, but its a proprietary thing that you'll have to not lose.  Seems I have a mini-usb with me no matter what I'm doing so this is sort of a pain because now I have to remember to grab this specific cable.The fourth is that it uses AA batteries to run.  Some might think this is not a con because you can get AA batteries no matter where you are, but I don't like it because charging is not quite as easy.  Though there are battery charges for AA batteries that you can plug into your car.  So it's not that big of a deal.I consider the cons external though in that you can work around them easily where as internally the camera functionality is top notch at this price.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-565UZ Camera
Reviews.Author: Allen Clark
Reviews.Content: Before my purchase of a Digital Camera, I first searched reviews and reports from several sources about the product.  I found that CONSUMER REPORTS had just done a review on this camera and had judged it as a solid product and first in it's class of cameras.  This prompted me to make this purchase.After my use of it and letting my daughter use it, we both found that the camera did all the jobs we wish to do with a Digital Camera.  We can make movie clips, action shots, wide angle and zoom shots ALL with clarity and great color.  My daughter liked it so well, I promptly purchased her one.As usual, Amazon did all the right "moves" with service, prompt delivery, follow up, and care and protection of my personal credit information.Allen ClarkBanner Elk, NC

Reviews.Title: Best Value
Reviews.Author: Ashwin Nayak "Ashwin Nayak"
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best advanced point and shoot one can buy.Pros:Its 20x is just awesome and a big plus if you want to get some great shots  needless to say with a tripod.Its image stabilization is also good.It has all the features that you can think of in a pro SLR camera. Its good fun to play around with all the features and see different affects.Cons:Night photography is not that good and is often hazy if the exposure is not set manually.Overall a very good investment.

Reviews.Title: This our fourth digital camera
Reviews.Author: B.C.
Reviews.Content: This is our fourth digital camera over the last 10 years or so.  It is by far the best camera, and the best value of any of the previous units.  I was fully impressed with our Nikon, and still satisfied with the quality of the photos that it produces.  Unfortunately, the main problem with the Nikon lies with me, not the camera, and will get worse with time. It's the dreaded "shakes".Most of the new cameras on the market have one means or another to deal with the "shakes" by one of four methods.  A few cameras compensate by matching the camera motion with the image chip, others by compensating with a lens element, and most of the rest by increasing the ISO setting or by increasing the shutter speed (known as digital stabilization).  The Olympus SP-565 can stabilize with three of the four methods (no lens compensation), yet retains fully automatic functions for other aspects.Look, this camera has way too many features to detail here.  This is a relatively compact camera that packs an incredible number of options.  If you want to point and shoot, leave it on "Auto".  If you want to control the image, there is an amazing array of possiblities.  It even has a "My Camera" feature that lets you set up the camera the way you want to (actually four different configurations), and stores it for quick selection when conditions warrant.Added - A year on, and I'm still well impressed.  The pics I've taken do not suffer from my bad shakes, which continue to worsen.

Reviews.Title: Olympus Sp-565UZ 10MP with 20x zoom
Reviews.Author: Theodore S. Bernardi "Scott B."
Reviews.Content: This is my second Olympus ultra-zoom; I bought it to replace an SP-560 I had for about a year before it was stolen.I was looking for a near SLR camera (one you could point and shoot, but also had easy access to adjust parameters), for around $300. Probably the main thing I wanted was a good wide angle as I shoot a lot of landscapes. This camera has an equivalent 35mm range of 26mm to 520mm, without changing lenses! The image stabilization really helps at the longer zooms.  It also takes fantastic macro shots.To see some pictures taken with this camera, see[...]You might also want to look atOlympus SP-570UZ 10MP Digital Camera with 20x Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom

Reviews.Title: Worth every penny!
Reviews.Author: C. Novotny "amateur photog"
Reviews.Content: After owning a little Olympus C50 for the past 4 years with no complaints other than power, I knew I wanted another Olympus camera when the time came to upgrade. I had read several rave reviews on the SP-565UZ so I was sold. I LOVE this camera - it has all the features I wanted - 20x zoom, red-eye reduction, SD card compatibility, landscape mode - plus all the controls a more seasoned photographer would want to tinker with. It's all that and more - easy to handle although sometimes you can hit the control buttons with your right hand so you have to be a little careful. The ONLY drawback to the camera in my opinion is that it takes 4 AA batteries (they come with the camera) and my other camera has a rechargeable battery. It's very convenient to just use one battery over and over again. I highly recommend this camera. It's just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: GREAT~ VERY EASY~
Reviews.Author: Christy Smith "Shutterbug"
Reviews.Content: I am a very big fan of Olympus Camera's, and this one is no different.It is very easy to use, the features are self explanitory, push a button and your shooting options are right there for you to choose from.  Point, shoot and get fantastic photos.  For the person who would love to be able to use the SLR-digital with the inter-changable lens, this is an all in one camera. The other thing I like about it is that it has the Display screen and view finder, for those sunny days that the display screen may not be as easy to see due to the sun reflecting off of the screen.  I also love the fact that it uses (4) AA batteries.

Reviews.Title: Nice Portable Super Zoom
Reviews.Author: David L. Brown
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera over 1 month ago and the Olympus is as solid as a Sherman Tank. This is the Bridge between the portable point and shoot and the larger more complicated ones such as the Canon SX10IS which I also own. I give the Canon a slight edge but this camera is no slouch and is better for every day use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Larry A. Gunseor
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera a week before we left on vacation for the Dominican Republic so I had little time to play with it before we left.  The camera is great I would recommend it to anyone, in the auto mode the camera auto focuses even at the 20x zoom and took good clear crisp pictures.  The Scene selection mode brings up a great menu describing what each selection does.  I know that there have been some less than good reviews on the video capture with this camera but that didn't concern me since I was buying for the photos.  This is a great digital camera at a reasonable price that won't disappoint you.

Reviews.Title: Superb sequential shooting
Reviews.Author: Shawn Van Haren "SVH27"
Reviews.Content: I searched several cameras for the feature of sequential shooting, as my main objective was getting a camera to capture athletic shots of my kids in action.  This camera has lived up to the reviews that drew me to the purchase.  I have come to really enjoy the 7 frames per second that the camera offers, while it has other options, such as 13 frames per second and 1.5 frames per second, the trade offs in photo quality make the 7 frames per second ideal for sports photography.  It also has many other features that the amateur photographer can learn to utilize; therefore as a whole I've been completely satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-565 10MP
Reviews.Author: E. Davies
Reviews.Content: I ordered the camera, wanting a higher MP and better zoom capabilities.  At first, I was disappointed with the large size of the camera compared to my older Olympus C-770 Ultra Zoom.  However, after using it several times, I have become used to the size.  It takes remarkable close-up pictures and takes good far away zoom pictures.  The camera arrived three days before the estimated time arrival which was amazing.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot, with a couple of reservations
Reviews.Author: Suki
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying using this camera. I largely do photos of kid-related events, with occasional more professional uses. My main complaint is that two of the best features are non-compatible: if you want the image stabilizer to work, you have to turn the sound recording off of video. This sounds fine, except when are you ever going to remember to turn the sound back ON when something is happening and you want to take a spur-of-the-moment video? Of course, you don't remember, so you get a silent film. So if you're me, you keep the image stabilizer off all the time, and thus that feature becomes irrelevant. It's not a huge thing, but a point worth considering if you're using the camera for ease of use and multiple functions. Otherwise I've been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful pictures
Reviews.Author: D. Knapp
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera after much research.  I didn't want an SLR with the camera bag, lenses, etc because I've been down that path.  I wanted something easier to use and less bulky, but more than a small point and shoot. I also wanted a view finder. I opened the box and immediately liked the way the camera felt in my hands.  I played with it a couple of days before going on vacation to really test it out.  I Love it!  It is so easy to use and takes great pictures.  I had several printed and have had people look at them and comment that they need to buy a new camera now that they have seen my pictures.  I was amazed at how nice the pics are even in low light conditions.  This camera is a good one for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot, with a couple of reservations
Reviews.Author: Suki
Reviews.Content: I'm really enjoying using this camera. I largely do photos of kid-related events, with occasional more professional uses. My main complaint is that two of the best features are non-compatible: if you want the image stabilizer to work, you have to turn the sound recording off of video. This sounds fine, except when are you ever going to remember to turn the sound back ON when something is happening and you want to take a spur-of-the-moment video? Of course, you don't remember, so you get a silent film. So if you're me, you keep the image stabilizer off all the time, and thus that feature becomes irrelevant. It's not a huge thing, but a point worth considering if you're using the camera for ease of use and multiple functions. Otherwise I've been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: perfect
Reviews.Author: Maria Valladares Membreno "Auxi"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, its options are excelent. Ilove to take pictures of flowers and nature and I have ha`d excelent results, I have pictures of hummingbirds and you have to know that is not easy!!!!

Reviews.Title: Glad I considered it...
Reviews.Author: V. Henry
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in December and used it during the Christmas Season.  The camera is easy to handle,not to heavy.  I found that the "Auto" selection is not like the point and click of my other camera.  I since have experimented with the many features to customize my photo taking, and found the quality to be very good. I have done everything from using the macro to using the full power of the zoom to take pictures of the mountains I see from my back yard. It has the ease of the point and shoot(and locks in the auto focus) but you have to think about what format to use (to get the best quality)when taking the picture. I am extremely happy with the purchase and for the price, you have to consider it.

Reviews.Title: Still learning
Reviews.Author: Dog House "Fish bird"
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of features and I'm still experimenting and learning with it. So far, I've been pleased. Got some great shots of my dogs - way better than with my old camera. The video feature is nice for capturing golf swings for review; the 13.5 fps sequential shooting is even more valuable for that. I haven't fully experienced everything this camera is capable of (panorama, super close-up...) but look forward to using it more when it warms up outside (camera not supposed to operate below freezing).

Reviews.Title: The Camera for Olympians!
Reviews.Author: Blair "Biblical Hebrew Made Easy!"
Reviews.Content: Want the BEST camera in this cameras price range? Then click on "Add to Cart" now. I researched, for three weeks, all major competitors (including, Sony, Panasonic, Fujifilm, Nikon and Cannon)and this easily beat them all in terms of features and optics. After using this camera, all my expectations were EXCEEDED. This camera is incredible! Please note, that this is not a simple 'point-and-shoot' camera. While it may be utilized as such, you will probably be disappointed at the results. I was looking for a 'bridge' camera - something beyond a simple point and shoot, but not as complex as a DSLR. This fits the bill PEFECTLY. You have the ability to control as much,or little,as you like with stunning results. While I have heard of others complaining regading navigating the camera and its functions, I found it to be a snap to learn in less than a day. I cannot highly enough recommend this camera to anyone on a budget that is looking for a quality 'bridge' camera. If you'd like, do your own research, Im certain you'll come to the same conclusion for the price- there simply is no other reasonable alternative to this camera by any other manufactuer for the price. Buy this camera and you'll feel like an Olympian (with no buyer's remorse to boot)!

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: L. R. ODOM
Reviews.Content: This camera offers much more than I know how to use. I use the "auto" and just point and click. It's the zoom that attracted me but I have enjoyed the super-macro and wide screen capabilities as much.  Some day I may learn more about photograghy and use some more settings allowing me to adjust the shutter speed etc. to my liking but for now I like the settings the way they are. Wonderful Camera!

Reviews.Title: Oly 565UZ Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: WAE "Teach"
Reviews.Content: Great camera!! It does everything, and then some, that I expected. I would recommend this to anyone, especially to someone that is looking for a point and shoot camera.  It's easy to use and has all the bells and whistles that one needs.  I especially like the way the menu is set up for ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Picture perfect snapsots
Reviews.Author: Treble Voice "Semibrief"
Reviews.Content: Very good little camera for amateur snapshots.  Excellent zoom -- great for graduations; anticipate good for concerts.  Takes more time than I have to learn the manual and more complicated settings.  Easy to upload pics to computer.  Have not tried in concert settings to see whether too noisy/distracting as was my fujifilm finepix $500 camera predecessor.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Little (Big) Camera
Reviews.Author: Sabene
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing camera.  It has been to Europe once, Mexico once and all over NYC, Chicago, Oregon, you name it and it has taken some great photos. I have a large SLR outfit that I prefer however it is heavy and certain trips are much easier with a lighter weight camera.  This camera is so easy to use, the menu is very simple and user friendly.  The zoom is phenominal and really captures a lot of close range shots without losing much definition.  It is compact and fits in a small camera bag.  I purchased the battery charger along with the camera and it fits in the bag as well.  The only thing I don't like about this camera is when you turn it on, the lens opens (obviously) but it pushes the lens cap off, even with lens cap line as long as possible.  Otherwise absolutely no complaints at all.  I LOVE this camera.

Reviews.Title: nice utility
Reviews.Author: KateLyn Sheehan
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for about 6 months now and have taken about 3000 pics with it. For the wide range of options you have to chose from when taking a picture, this camera does a pretty good job. The zoom is substantial and the focus is good as long as the batteries are fresh. Battery life is super short (200 pics) and goes down substantially when using the high-power zoom. The autofocus also struggles to get the correct object in focus when the zoom is employed too. That being said, for the price, I wouldn't have done any differently and keep this at my side all the time becaue it takes a great shot no matter what the circumstance (just be sure you have extra betteries on hand). Overall a good buy and a great camera.

Reviews.Title: Very Pleased
Reviews.Author: Anthony Friend
Reviews.Content: Coming from back in the day of old SLR's this is a very user friendly camera.  The menus are very intuitieve once you learn where they are located.  My 5 year old can even produce excellent pictures with very little or no effort.

Reviews.Title: Great value camera for beginners!
Reviews.Author: Richard Clark
Reviews.Content: Great product!! So far no major issue with its use..... it is a great buy for beginners in the more professional photograph segment. Couple of comments: first, the camera is not that intuitive to use (some functions like sephia are not included in the camera but in the software)although it is very easy to manipulate and second, the battery system (4 x AA batteries) are a little bit uncomfortable to handle (would have preferred a single rechargeable battery instead).

Reviews.Title: Lovin' it!
Reviews.Author: M. Hall "Baja Bound"
Reviews.Content: I thought I wanted extra zoom power and I would only find it by buying big with extra ad on lenses, but I got nervous when I read a warning about changing lenses in a dusty area! What a great camera this is with its built in 20x Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom! I took it on a camping trip this weekend and had great fun learning all its features. I especially like the Panorama mode that puts 3 shots together automatically! Great price, great features, great camera!

Reviews.Title: I Love This Camera
Reviews.Author: Shannon K. Carpenter
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera. It is so easy to use. It is light weight and the zoom works very well. The macro takes great close-ups. The battery life has been satisfactory. I have some quality portraits and some great snow scenes taken with the special scn settings. I highly reccommend it!

Reviews.Title: No Sound with the Video Record Setting??!
Reviews.Author: M. Lee
Reviews.Content: Pro: For the most part, I am happy with this camera's shooting capabilities. I've used it since 2009 and I purchased it because of its 20x optical zoom. It is simple to use. I love taking close up photos of animals with this camera.Meh: Battery life is so-so. I always carry a spare set for longer trips.Con: This camera's video record setting does not record sound! For some odd reason, there is no sound when I replay the videos on the camera and also there was no sound when I transfer the videos onto my computer!If you can solve the missing audio sound mystery, I will be very appreciative.

Reviews.Title: Second verse, same as the first.....
Reviews.Author: J. Roger Wade
Reviews.Content: Five or six years ago I purchased an Olympus 3040N which was my first digital camera and my first use of an Olympus anything.  If I said that I was delighted in it would be a vast understatement.  My wife and I are hikers, and the little camera was excellent from several points of view.  It was light to carry, took great pictures, and one of the main points, because of the f1.8 lens, light in the deep woods was never a problem.  When it chose to "give up the ghost" a couple of months ago, I paniced because none of the cameras of similar rank had anything below f2.8.  I finally gave in and bought the SP565UZ with fear and trembling.  As reflected in my revues' title, my second verse of Olympus is so far as satisfying as the first. I can't wait to get it on the trails...great camera!  Roger Wade

Reviews.Title: Great automatic camera which allows flexible programming
Reviews.Author: T. Muegel
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera as a step up from an old Olympus Camedia, 5 megapixel with a 10x zoom.  Its programs, especially in Scene mode, are much improved and easier to use.  The flip up flash is a good feature because it can be used to prevent the flash from accidentally going off in an area (such as museums) where flash is forbidden.  This is the perfect camera for the serious photographer who doesn't want to carry several extra lenses with a SLR.  So far, the stabilization system has worked well when shooting in moving vehicles.

Reviews.Title: still learning
Reviews.Author: T. Wagner "capttom"
Reviews.Content: this camera does so much, im still reading the manual. it does require you to put in some practice, not exactly point and shoot. with a little effort tho it takes great pictures. shipping was amazingly fast.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: D. Clark
Reviews.Content: takes awsome pictures ,lives up to what i wanted ,good price,was shipped on time with out damage

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Michael W. Urban
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a last second idea for my trip to Thailand. I got it with time to spare and using mostly the auto setting I am getting fantastic pictures. Great camera at a great price!

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-565UZ
Reviews.Author: L. M. Rodrigue "Chinalaker"
Reviews.Content: I am enjoying this camera very much. I learn something everytime I use it. The manual is very helpful and easy to understand. I am disappointed with the batteries however. The batteries that came with the camera were typical AA's and needed to be replaced very quickly. I purchased some rechargables and luckily we alreay had a charger. My last camera was a Casio and it had a rechargeable battery and charger which was very conveniant. Overall, I'm pretty happy with the camera and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: poor focus on tmer operation
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Micael "old pro"
Reviews.Content: i like the olympus 565 light weight ease of operation. i was just wondering why some of the features on edit are missing unlike those featured in the sp510 the frame and label etc. on operating the timer feature i sometimes experience focus problems i tried several settings, sometimes i get it right i might not be doing it correctly. the zoom and wide angle are great specially in small areas where space is limited. i have a wonderful time using my sp565 together with my sp510.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-565UZ
Reviews.Author: Jeff Morrow
Reviews.Content: Pretty nice camera, features take a while to get used to- Gave it as a Christmas gift to my wife and first pics were blurry- master reset button is a must to locate!  Great zoom, IR Red LED is a little annoying when taking pics, but a good camera

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: EW
Reviews.Content: I have had my SP-565UZ for two months now and used it in various conditions, indoor, outdoor, bright background, snow, cloudy and have found it to be very flexible. My pictures are getting better and better as I learn to use the many features of the camera. This was a major upgrade for me from my old Olympus C-700 UZ which I have had for 6 years.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-565UZ
Reviews.Author: rvrguyd
Reviews.Content: Takes great pictures and has a tone of features and settings to get the best pictures.  A professional might like a camera like this but for me, it gets a bit complicated and literally I needed to download and print an entire instructional manual to figure out all the features.  I like to keep it simple but if you want to experiment, you can certainly do it with this camera.  It has a great zoom feature.  I have used it more for film clips to YouTube and it has good sound quality with no noticeable motor noise while zoning.

Reviews.Title: My primary camera
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Cote "Paul"
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for quite a while and use it extensively. It has so many features that I am still not fully up to speed on its full capability. It takes excellent pictures that I use to publish two web sites, one newsletter and multiple sets in my Flickr account. Best camera I have owned to date.

Reviews.Title: Highly Recommend
Reviews.Author: ddgeorgia
Reviews.Content: this has been a great point and shoot camera for me!  easy to use, great photos, love the 'scene' settings.  Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: Great quality from Olympus
Reviews.Author: H. Hudson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera several years ago as a gift to my wife, and apparently I have yet to write a review.  Wow.  Ok, well this may benefit the end user, since my wife and I have spent several years using it and therefore can give a more accurate review.The summary of my experience is this:  This is probably the best camera I have ever used that is not a full SLR or DSLR.  The versatility and picture quality is absolutely stunning.  My wife is a passionate amateur photographer, and she has really used this device to the fullest.Some of the pros we have noticed:* Great picture quality, even at high speeds.  My wife has a tendency to actually hang this camera out the car window and snap shots on the fly (somehow she has never dropped it so far). These shots usually come out as if we were not moving at all.  The only exception to this is low light conditions.* Great zoom capability.  20x zoom works great, and the image stabilization keeps things nice and sharp even at the furthest zoom.* Great features.  There are tons of things to play with as far as different scene selections and lighting modes.  'Low light' is a pretty neat feature for taking dusk shots and the like (although the pic quality does suffer just a bit).  You can snap panoramic shots that turn out great.  I am leaving a ton out here, but for the sake of time just take my word for it; if you can find this camera still you won't be disappointed with the feature set.And the very few cons:* Not a DSLR.  This sort of speaks for itself, but no interchangeable lenses and the like.* Uses a proprietary memory card.  This camera uses the olympus XD storage card, which has some well documented limitations.* Under performs in low light conditions.  The pics at night and in various low light settings just don't tend to turn out that great.Overall a great camera.  When I bought it almost 4 years ago it was a $350 camera and for my money it was a bargain at that price.  I'm seeing now that you can find it used on amazon for $75, and to that I say you need to buy it now.  At that price, its worth purchasing as a backup for your DSLR if nothing else.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!!
Reviews.Author: Tiger mama
Reviews.Content: This is my second one and I love it! It is very easy to handle, great zoom and it takes wonderful pictures!

Reviews.Title: We use it a lot
Reviews.Author: Mariana Stambullian
Reviews.Content: We have this product since 2009, and we use a lot. We are very satify about this product. Thnak you

Reviews.Title: Not satisfied!
Reviews.Author: Jenine
Reviews.Content: This camera was just so-so....I expected a much better functioning camera but this is not it!  I will not buy Olympus again due to the experience I had with this camera....focus is very slow and the reaction time is ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Elantrian
Reviews.Content: Seems to do everything promised, and takes pictures just like a DSLR. The only really major difference between this and the much more expensive (and newer) options is the lack of interchangeable lenses.In other words, if you are a moderately skilled amateur who wants to take high quality pictures like a pro, this should do the trick.I haven't tried it in super low light conditions yet (an area in which many low priced cameras fail), but in moderately low light situations it seems to do just fine.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: SirGypsy
Reviews.Content: I am not a professional photographer, just enjoy taking pictures and for the most part this camera has been good to me.  I really like many of the night shots, but really find myself just using the action setting for all(but that might be because I feel like I shake too much, and the quicker the shutter, the better).

Reviews.Title: Great for some purposes
Reviews.Author: Fasi Z
Reviews.Content: I have had the Olympus SP-565UZ for three years now. The camera, a point and shoot, does well for the following purposes:a. Close ups and portraitsb. Baby photos using available lightc. Zooming in to long range subjectsWhere it is short:a. Night photography is poor, even with the flashlightb. At max zoom the blur can be considerable for shaky hands.Overall I have had a great experience with it, does well for a regular use piece.

Reviews.Title: Best professional grade bang for the buck
Reviews.Author: Forensic Engineer "Al"
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. The 20x telephoto combined with 5x digita zoom means 100x and I can read the writing on a bolt head on a 40ft ceiling. Image stabilizer eliminates need for a tripod. Macro function as good as it gets. Guide function means you can forget everything and the camera tells you what to do in the field. 3 years of field use & airplane travel & still going strong. Got it for $300 3 years ago what a deal! Thanks Olympus

Reviews.Title: Accidental starting and defected lens cap
Reviews.Author: Adolfo Scatena
Reviews.Content: La tapa del lente se sale en forma permanente.  No tiene un modo de ajuste dejando al lente sin proteccion.Luego, estando guardada en su bolso, al extraerla y habiendola guardado apagada y con la tapa del lente puesto, la encontre encendida y con su lente expandido.Busque si tenia una forma de seguridad para el apagado/encendido pero no lo halle.  No hay forma de evitar el encendido accidental de la maquina.Creo que ambos detalles descriptos  contituyen problemas y determinan serias falencias en una maquina que, por otra parte, tiene multiples funciones y prestaciones mediante las cuales se aspira a posicionarla en un alto nivel en el mercado de las maquinas compactas, careciendo de dos detalles aparentemente menores pero que en absoluto lo son.Le agradeceria que me  ofrezca una solucion a ambos problemas o adonde debo recurrir para ello.

Reviews.Title: One great digital camera
Reviews.Author: Love Green "Jack"
Reviews.Content: Before I bought this camera I did a lot of research.  I have a point and shoot Olympus and I loved it.  This is NO point and shoot...but once I got used to it...I can tell you that I love it to.  In fact, my daughter saw it and used it and her husband bought her one for an anniversary gift!  This camera does more things than I can ever realize...have had it awhile and I am still learning things about it.  A great digital camera.

Reviews.Title: Best camera in its price range
Reviews.Author: J. A. Grim "meteorologist"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after researching a ton of cameras in the price range.  After using it for 1.5 years now, and having taken thousands of photos, I am as happy as ever with it.  It was a great deal and has so much functionality, I'm still learning to use all of it.  I take this camera on my many off-trail hikes, and despite jiggling around so much, it continues to work just fine.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-565UZ
Reviews.Author: Darryl J. Millet
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera last year for soccer. It takes awesome photos.  20x optical zoom is unbelievable. Very easy to use too.  I probably know about as much as the next person when it comes to photography.  Nothing!  With a little help from a friend, I was taking some great action shots at all my Daughter's soccer games.  I was missing out on a lot of great shots from the previous years. The computer software is very user friendly.  It sorts by dates, which makes locating and sorting very easy.  Photos and videos load fast too.  I use rechargable batteries and keep 4 extra in the case for when I'm taking thousands of shots @ tournaments.  I have never been in a situation where I ran all the batteries down. I highly recomend this product.  Olympus SP-565UZ 10MP Digital Camera with 20x Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: M. Larson
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a trip to Zion and Byrce National and what great pictures we got. The pictures are so clear it looks like we are still there. One of the neat features of this camera is the seting for doc. We use it a number of time to phot the information at different places at the parks.We are not pros but this camera make us look like pros

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: J.L "J.L"
Reviews.Content: EASY TO USE CAMERA WITH A LOT OF AUTOMATIC SETTINGS AND FEATURES; FOR THE EVERYDAY PHOTOGRAPHER WHO WANT'S A BETTER PICTURE THAN TAKEN WITH THOSE LITTLE CAMERAS. I TRIED THIS CAMERA IN DIFERENT LIGHT CONDITIONS INTERIORS AND (GREAT PICS).I SPECIALY LOVE THE WIDE ANGLE LENS, THE SOON, FOCUS AND BETTER FLASH THAN THE LITTLE CAMERAS.J.L

Reviews.Title: I am please with my new camera
Reviews.Author: M. Murphy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for the zoom capability and have been pleased with everything about it.  I still am learning about it as I use it, it is user-friendly.

Reviews.Title: super good!
Reviews.Author: Patty Miller "beadmaker"
Reviews.Content: Great camera! Great pics. A littel more than I want to have to do but I like a point and shoot! It's not much more complicated though.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-565UZ
Reviews.Author: R. Brown
Reviews.Content: I have had the camera for about a month now and am spending a lot of time learning how to use it. It is a liitle smaller than I imagined but as I only have full use of one hand, it is very satisfactory.  There are many very nice features, one that I really like is Panorama.  It works very well. I especially like the fact that it uses "AA" batteries. Good rechargables give me many pictures and I haven't run out of power, yet. I normally keep 2 sets of batteries available and after shooting photos, replace the used ones with ones that have been recharged.I am still undecided about a focusing issue where it doesn't seem as sharp as it could be but am experimenting with different settings.  I guess, time will tell.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Jerry M. Hoffman "Michael"
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  Easy to take pictures. Pictures are high quality. Lots of manual features which I also wanted. Also easy to take quick pics on auto with no manual selections. I purchased a small Casio Exilim about the same time and the Olympus totally leaves that camera in the dust as far as a quality image is concerned. I'm very pleased with the Olympus.

Reviews.Title: Okay for some, but not me
Reviews.Author: Diana
Reviews.Content: My husband is an amateur photographer and thinks this is a pretty good camera.  He's had it for two years and still hasn't figured out all of it's settings, etc.  That's too complicated for me.  We used to share an mid-range camera that we loved (and even spent a lot to fix), but I don't like this one.  I get just as good a picture on my little Kodak 10.3 pixel, and I don't miss shots due to camera delay and poor settings.  This is not a good family camera; don't buy it if you have kids or grandkids.

Reviews.Title: Good family camera
Reviews.Author: V. Hohe
Reviews.Content: Stuck with the Olympus brand when my last camera died.  Happy with the camera and photos, but wish it had the old lithium battery of my last Olympus...replacing batteries is a PAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: Olympus 565UZ digital camera
Reviews.Author: Bo in MN
Reviews.Content: Based on my initial impression, this is a very good camera.  It has LOTS of features that I have not had time to learn to use as much as I'd like.  The finest camera I have ever owned.  I had researched many cameras prior to purchasing this camera and it was the best buy in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amy J. Bishop "Amy B"
Reviews.Content: I just love this camera. It takes awesome pictures. They are so clear. I've looked alot of camera and looked alot a reviews and this camera is #1 in my book. I'm still learning all the features it has. If your looking for a good camera and don't want to pay $1000's of dollars, this is the one to buy.

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP-565UZ Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Melvin G. Weimeister
Reviews.Content: This product displayed purple streaking at long focal lengths. It was returned in spite of the sizable restocking penalty. I didn't compromise the second time. I bought a Nikon D80 with all the lenses and accessories and am I happy with it! It always pays to buy a proven and well-reviewed product right out of the gate. Mel Wymystr

Reviews.Title: Poor Instruction Booklet
Reviews.Author: Karen Bills "cat lover and eagle addict"
Reviews.Content: I'm disappointed in that I thought this would be a great "point and shoot" camera with the biggest zoom available on that type of camera.  It's very hard to figure out how to use and the instruction booklet is practically worthless.  Someone who knows how to use an SLR probably wouldn't have the problem that I am having.  I may go back to using my "point and shoot" 35mm film camera with a 110mm zoom.  It takes great pictures.  I just wanted a better zoom for shooting pictures of eagles.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for a great price
Reviews.Author: Prasanth Janardhanan "Prasanth"
Reviews.Content: [...]I had a Canon sx100 IS, fully working, but couldnt resist the price from Dell.and it turned out that I got a great product. It has numerous scene modes, high speed modes, and the best thing I like as an ametuer, they have a mode called GUIDE, where it will guide you to change it to specific modes based on the situation you need.overall, a great camera!!!

Reviews.Title: The most awesome camera ever.
Reviews.Author: Hot Teacher "Panda"
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this item. I have never used a piece of camera equipment this fabulous.

Reviews.Title: The Best Buy for your MONEY
Reviews.Author: Luis Jacinto "LJV"
Reviews.Content: WOW, i bought these camera for my birthday, in the past i use film cameras some sony digitals and a olympus camera but with these i think i cover everything an amateur needs for getting great pics.

Reviews.Title: blurry
Reviews.Author: J. Hofker
Reviews.Content: took a while to get used to using this camera-the pictures were coming out blurry but after a while got to understand how to use-now its taking great pictures and well worth it

Reviews.Title: Olympus SP - 565UZ
Reviews.Author: Marta Wever
Reviews.Content: Amazon: Thank you very much for your service. Evrything was fine with my purchase, except the batteries that were included with the camera, they didn't work...I would like to recieve information about the different accesories that you have for this camera and the differnt sales.ThanksMarta W.

Reviews.Title: cable wont fit the usb port
Reviews.Author: Eamonthemud "Eamon"
Reviews.Content: Great camera takes great pictures and is pretty intuitive to use for beginners. What the hell is wrong with the usb port? The cable that came with it just wont fit. Neither will other cables. Now what?

Reviews.Title: What a great camera
Reviews.Author: James Halverson Jr.
Reviews.Content: This camera works very well. It takes very very good pics. The different setting makes taking different pics so very easy. Makes you look like a pro. My [...]  can take good pics with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Lost very important photos because of this camera
Reviews.Author: J. STARK
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera in February and tried it out a couple of times at birthday parties for practice. It felt too light weight (very cheaply made) and it took a while for the camera to focus before I could take the picture. I have always purchased Canon cameras in the past but I figured I would give this Olympus a try. Most of the photos did come out nice, some were blurry. A couple of weeks ago we took a cruise and I was taking a lot of photos. I was up to 450+ images on a 2gb XD card when I tried taking a night time shot. As I pressed the shutter to focus the camera the LCD screen flashed all different colors and I got an Error message. I tried looking at the photos that I took from my vacation and 2/3 of them said "Corrupt File". I didn't want to mess with it while away so I purchased a new XD card to continue taking photos. When I returned home I started to download the images and only had a small portion of the photos. I tired using 4 different Image Recovery programs with no luck. I am very disappointed that my photos are gone. I contacted Amazon.com and to their credit they let me return the defective camera. I think I will stick with my Canon cameras from now on.

Reviews.Title: Not sure yet
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because of all of the extra features.  However, after using it for a couple of weeks, I still haven't gotten a good action shot or night shot.  I hope this is still my learning curve.  I am still playing with settings.  According to the specs, I should be getting much better pictures than with my last digital.  So I am still trying to find the right combination of settings.

Reviews.Title: Correcting Amazon Description
Reviews.Author: Snap fan "Duke"
Reviews.Content: Amazon  should  correct the media  accepted  by  this camera. According to Olympus  website: "Removable Media Card xD-Picture Card(tm) (1GB, 2GB), microSD (MASD-1 is required."  Just my two cents. I rated  this camera  3  stars  just  bacause  is  needed  for  a  review, but  I really never  played  with  this  camera.

ProductInfo.Features:
10-megapixel image sensor captures enough detail for photo-quality 18 x 24-inch prints
20x optical dual image-stabilized zoom
High-speed sequential shooting and pre-capture; manual controls plus 33 shooting modes
Face Detection; Perfect Shot Preview and Shadow Adjustment Technology
Capture images to xD-Picture Card and microSD memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Olympus SP-565UZ 10MP Digital Camera with 20x Optical Dual Image Stabilized Zoom
